text:
With the rebuild flag set to false, the ejb-jar being generated by the 
<weblogic> did not have the correct, most up to date files.  Two bugs exist in 
the code for finding changed files.  One prematurely breaks out of the loop 
when any flat file is reached.  The other causes a rebuild on non-critical flat 
files (non-xml files).
creator: david@ashman.com
conor@apache.org
text: I'm investigating. Have you got an example (test case) where this occurs?

creator: mondrejko@acm.org
text:
I saw this problem when making only a change to a EJB implementation class, 
when the modified class came after the MANIFEST in the generic EJB jar. Instead 
of simply ignoring the MANIFEST difference (as specified in the comment), the 
code would break out of the difference check and therefore miss updating 
changed files in the generic EJB jar in the weblogic EJB jar. A proposed patch 
for fixing this problem is attached.

creator: mondrejko@acm.org
